wekabci.server.protocol
Interface Message

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractMessage, Bye, Classifier, Halt, Hello, Ping, Save, Show, Signal, Stop
public interface Message

This interface declare the minimum methods that every message must be able to execute. The protocol is thought as a finite state machine, starting from a NEW state and then moving to other states according to different messages.

Author:
Jorge

Method Summary
 Protocol.States getNewState()
          Returns the new state for the protocol due to the result of the processing of the message.
 Protocol getProtocol()
          Returns the protocol to which the message belongs to.
 java.lang.String getResponse()
          Returns the response to the last processed message.
 java.lang.String processMessage(java.lang.String message)
          Processes the message from the client
 void setProtocol(Protocol protocol)
          Sets the protocol to which the message belongs to.
 boolean validateState(Protocol.States state)
          Validates if a particular state is valid for the message execution
